com.illcode.meterman.ui

Interface MetermanUI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SwingUI

    public interface MetermanUI
    An interface describing the functionality present in all UI implementations.

    Currently there is only a Swing interface (SwingUI).

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        Initializes the UI.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Hides the interface and disposes of any resources used by the UI.

      • run

        boolean run()
        Run the UI event loop, if applicable.
        Returns:
        true if the main thread should call Meterman.shutdown() after run() returns; false if the UI will call shutdown() itself when the UI is closed (as in the case for Swing/AWT interfaces, where event dispatch is performed on a separate non-daemon thread).

      • setGameName

        void setGameName(String name)
        Sets the frame title (or equivalent) and About menu text to show the game name.
        Parameters:
        name - game name, or null if no game loaded

      • openURL

        void openURL(String url)
        Opens a web browser to the given URL, if applicable. If the UI doesn't support this, or the URL is malformed, nothing will happen.
        Parameters:
        url - URL to open

      • loadImage

        void loadImage(String name,
             Path p)
        Load an image into the UI. JPEG and PNG (with bitmask transparency) are supported.
        Parameters:
        name - name by which the image will be referred to in the setXXXImage() methods.
        p - path of the image file.

      • unloadImage

        void unloadImage(String name)
        Unload an image from the UI.
        Parameters:
        name - name of image

      • unloadAllImages

        void unloadAllImages()
        Unload all images from the UI.

      • setFrameImage

        void setFrameImage(String imageName)
        Sets the image displayed in the main UI frame. The recommended size for frame images is 150x400 pixels, or an integer fraction of that, in which case the image will be scaled up.
        Parameters:
        imageName - name of the image, as chosen in loadImage(String, Path)

      • getFrameImage

        String getFrameImage()
        Get the name of the current frame image. This can be useful if a game object wants to save the current image name so that it can restore it later.
        Returns:
        the name of the current frame image.

      • setEntityImage

        void setEntityImage(String imageName)
        Sets the entity image that will be drawn inset in the frame image. The recommended size for entity images is 140x140 pixels, or an integer fraction of that, in which case the image will be scaled up; the image itself should have a border to visually separate it from the frame image.
        Parameters:
        imageName - name of the image, as chosen in loadImage(String, Path)

      • getEntityImage

        String getEntityImage()
        Get the name of the current entity image. This can be useful if a game object wants to save the current image name so that it can restore it later.
        Returns:
        the name of the current entity image.

      • setRoomName

        void setRoomName(String name)
        Sets the room name displayed in the UI
        Parameters:
        name - room name

      • clearText

        void clearText()
        Clears the main text area.

      • appendText

        void appendText(String text)
        Appends text to the main text area.
        Parameters:
        text - text to append

      • appendNewline

        void appendNewline()
        Appens a newline to the main text area.

      • appendTextLn

        void appendTextLn(String text)
        Appends text to the main text area, followed by a newline.
        Parameters:
        text - text to append

      • setObjectName

        void setObjectName(String name)
        Sets the object name displayed above the description text area.
        Parameters:
        name - object name

      • setObjectText

        void setObjectText(String text)
        Sets the object text displayed in the selected object area.
        Parameters:
        text - text to display

      • clearRoomEntities

        void clearRoomEntities()
        Clears the list displaying Entities in the current room.

      • addRoomEntity

        void addRoomEntity(Entity e)
        Adds an entity to the list of entities in the current room.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to add

      • removeRoomEntity

        void removeRoomEntity(Entity e)
        Removes an entity from the list of entities in the current room.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to remove

      • refreshRoomEntity

        void refreshRoomEntity(Entity e)
        Refresh the list item corresponding to an entity in the current room.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to refresh

      • clearInventoryEntities

        void clearInventoryEntities()
        Clears the list displaying Entities in the player's inventory.

      • addInventoryEntity

        void addInventoryEntity(Entity e,
                      String modifiers)
        Adds an entity to the list of entities in the player's inventory.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to add
        modifiers - string to append to the list display for the entity, to indicate status like worn or equipped. Will be null if there are no modifiers.

      • removeInventoryEntity

        void removeInventoryEntity(Entity e)
        Removes an entity from the list of entities in the player's inventory.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to remove

      • refreshInventoryEntity

        void refreshInventoryEntity(Entity e,
                          String modifiers)
        Refresh the list item corresponding to an entity in inventory.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to refresh
        modifiers - string to append to the list display for the entity, to indicate status like worn or equipped. Will be null if there are no modifiers.

      • selectEntity

        void selectEntity(Entity e)
        Cause a given entity to be selected in the UI, if it is present in the room or inventory lists.
        Parameters:
        e - entity to select

      • clearEntitySelection

        void clearEntitySelection()
        Clears any selection in the room and inventory entity lists.

      • clearExits

        void clearExits()
        Clears the exit button list.

      • setExitLabel

        void setExitLabel(int buttonPos,
                String label)
        Sets a given exit button to a Room, or hides it.
        Parameters:
        buttonPos - one of the constants indicating a button position (ex. UIConstants.N_BUTTON)
        label - label to use for the specified exit button; if null, the given button will be hidden.

      • clearActions

        void clearActions()
        Clears the action button group.

      • addAction

        void addAction(String actionLabel)
        Add an action to the action button list. If an action with the same label is already shown, this method will return without any effect.
        Parameters:
        actionLabel - action to add

      • removeAction

        void removeAction(String actionLabel)
        Removes an action from the action button list.
        Parameters:
        actionLabel - action to remove

      • setStatusLabel

        void setStatusLabel(int labelPosition,
                  String label)
        Sets one of the three status bar labels.
        Parameters:
        labelPosition - one of UIConstants.LEFT_LABEL, UIConstants.CENTER_LABEL, UIConstants.RIGHT_LABEL
        label - the text to show for the given label

      • showTextDialog

        void showTextDialog(String header,
                  String text,
                  String buttonLabel)
        Displays a modal dialog showing a passage of text.
        Parameters:
        header - header surmounted above the text passage
        text - text passage (line-breaks kept intact)
        buttonLabel - label of the button to dismiss dialog

      • showPromptDialog

        String showPromptDialog(String header,
                      String text,
                      String prompt,
                      String initialText)
        Displays a modal dialog showing a passage of text and a field for the user to enter a line of text.
        Parameters:
        header - header surmounted above the text passage
        text - text passage (line-breaks kept intact)
        prompt - prompt displayed in front of the field
        initialText - the text initially set in the text field
        Returns:
        the text entered by the user

      • showListDialog

        <T> T showListDialog(String header,
                   String text,
                   List<T> items,
                   boolean showCancelButton)
        Shows a dialog allowing the user to select one of a list of items.
        Parameters:
        header - header surmounted above the text passage
        text - text passage (line-breaks kept intact)
        items - items from which the user can select one
        showCancelButton - if true, a cancel button will be shown; if clicked, this method will return null
        Returns:
        the item selected, or null if no item selected.

      • showImageDialog

        void showImageDialog(String header,
                   String imageName,
                   int scale,
                   String text,
                   String buttonLabel)
        Shows a dialog displaying an image.
        Parameters:
        header - header surmounted above the image
        imageName - name of the image, as chosen in loadImage(String, Path)
        scale - the factor (>= 1) by which the image will be scaled before being shown
        text - text passage (line-breaks kept intact) shown below the image
        buttonLabel - label of the button used to dismiss dialog

      • showWaitDialog

        void showWaitDialog(String message)
        Displays an always-on-top dialog with a message, that stays visible until hidden. It is intended to inform the user when a potentially long-running operation is taking place.
        Parameters:
        message - message to show

      • hideWaitDialog

        void hideWaitDialog()
        Hides the dialog previously shown by showWaitDialog(String).
